subsc: Central government administration,Power,General industry and trade sector,Agro-industry, marketing, and trade,General agriculture, fishing and forestry sector

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Second Structural
            Adjustment Credit is to support the implementation of the
            second phase of Zimbabwe's structural adjustment
            program. Given good progress in the first phase of the
            program and taking into account the effects of the 1992
            drought, this support is appropriate and in line with the
            Bank's assistance strategy for Zimbabwe. The credit
            focuses on generating more rapid supply response, while
            continuing efforts to restore macroeconomic stability,
            improve public sector management and shield poor and
            vulnerable groups from harsh transitional effects arising
            from adjustment. To achieve the rapid increase in investment
            and exports which are vital to the sustainability and
            success of structural adjustment in Zimbabawe, the credit
            will support: (a) further trade policy reform to promote
            exports; (b) investment delicensing to facilitate an
            increase in private investment; and (c) agricultural
            marketing and price reform to broaden private sector
            involvement and competition.
